result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Motion hearing on December 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Judge wants you to remain on the case

Clerk: Heather.
Case Called: 2:17 p.m.
INCLUDES: 21CF1081, 22CF459.
State appears by ADA Alex Lech in person. Defendant appears in person from MCJ, with Atty John Wallace via Zoom.
Date and time set for a status conference. 
VRCW. 

COURT has reviewed recent filings, as well as the motion to withdraw.
Atty Wallace makes good faith effort to try to work with the defendant. 
COURT addresses parties. 
Atty Wallace requests the sentencing after revocation to be postponed so he can come and speak with Defendant. 
ADA Lech has no position.
COURT further addresses parties, recommends parties try to communicate so the case can move forward.

State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher; Deft appears in person, in custody, pro se. 
COURT questions deft regarding proceeding today without an attorney. 
Deft states wish to proceed. 
Prelim Testifier, Jessica Allsen, sworn and testifies. 
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information to be E-filed. Information Read. 
Plea: Not Guilty.

cc: Br. 2
Preliminary Hearing on April 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.

AMENDED.  Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons during the pendency of this action.    Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (2) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
